src.Games

Interface MoveConverter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChessMoveKonverter

    public interface MoveConverter
    The client only returns a simple String-description of the move. MoveConverter converts this String into the current state of the gameBoard.
    Author:
    Beg√ºm Tosun & Alexander Posch

      PlayingPiece[][] convertStringToState(GameBoard gameBoard, java.lang.String move)
      This method gets a String description of the move and converts it onto the current game board state which is a two dimensional PlayingPiece array.

      • convertStringToState

        PlayingPiece[][] convertStringToState(GameBoard gameBoard,
                                      java.lang.String move)
        This method gets a String description of the move and converts it onto the current game board state which is a two dimensional PlayingPiece array.
        Parameters:

        move - String
        Returns:
        currentState: PlayingPiece[][]

      • stateToString

        static java.lang.String stateToString(PlayingPiece[][] currentState,
                                      PlayingPiece[][] stateToCheck)
        Converts the new state which is a PlayingPiece[][] into a String which describes the move. Warning!! It is provided that the move is not castling.
        Parameters:
        currentState - PlayingPiece[][]
        stateToCheck - PlayingPiece[][]
        Returns:
        String
